title: Database Sales Specialist
description:
### **Minimum qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience.
* 10 years of experience with consulting sales environments focusing on cloud databases.
* Experience engaging with, and presenting to, technical stakeholders and executive leaders.
* Experience building and scaling demand generation and pipeline progression programs.
* Experience consulting on Oracle databases and their related business application ecosystem.
* Experience with database workload migration and the commercial and business issues in moving these workloads to public cloud.

  

### **Preferred qualifications:**

* Experience in building customer relationships and strategic advisory.
* Experience developing and growing C-level relationships.
* Understanding of executive decision making process and consultative problem/solution positioning.
* Understanding of the financial and technical issues in managing modern day IT operations at large corporations.
* Ability to communicate complex topics to an audience with various functional knowledge.
* Excellent business (e.g., financial accounting, ROI, TCO, budget planning, organisational design) and presentation skills, including public speaking, meeting facilitation, and white boarding.

**About the job**
-----------------


The Google Cloud Platform team helps customers transform and build what's next for their business — all with technology built in the cloud. Our products are developed for security, reliability and scalability, running the full stack from infrastructure to applications to devices and hardware. Our teams are dedicated to helping our customers — developers, small and large businesses, educational institutions and government agencies — see the benefits of our technology come to life. As part of an entrepreneurial team in this rapidly growing business, you will play a key role in understanding the needs of our customers and help shape the future of businesses of all sizes use technology to connect with customers, employees and partners.



Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Conduct strategic account planning with Google Account teams and drive adoption of Database Workload Migrations to Google Cloud Platform.
* Establish working relationships with Google strategic Account teams, leadership and other internal teams to build and progress business pipelines and opportunities for Database Workload Migration.
* Work with counterpart technical specialists to ensure solution assurance sign-off of database migrations from both commercial and technical perspectives.
* Seek to streamline, standardize, and scale the approach and develop new offerings as well as assisting in Return on Investment (ROI) and Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) analysis.
* Coach and develop Google Account teams on value promotions for Database Workload Migration in collaboration with Cloud Value Advisors, sharing best practices and elevating strategic mindshare with the accounts.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form.

title: Sveriges Radio söker en erfaren utvecklare med ljudet i fokus Stockholm | Tech/IT 23 juni 2024
description:
Nu erbjuder Sveriges Radio en unik möjlighet att vara med i utvecklingen av vårt nya radioproduktionssystem.



Uppdraget ligger inom avdelning RPS, RadioProduktionsSystem, som idag består av fyra agila team som utvecklar både mjuk- och hårdvara. Här finns gott om utrymme för visionärt och kompetent tänkande kring lösningar som kan ge stor effekt för den infrastruktur som mixersystemen ska vara en del av. Vi jobbar tillsammans med flera olika team både inom avdelningen samt med vår teknikavdelning.



Som medlem i våra agila team på Sveriges Radio är du med och utvecklar ny teknik i en ständigt föränderlig värld som gör att vi kan fortsätta ligga i framkant och göra radio i världsklass. Mitt i händelsernas centrum blir du en viktig del av ett företag som värnar om demokrati, det fria ordet och alla människors lika värde. Vi skapar oberoende radio för hela livet, hela landet och på alla relevanta plattformar.



Vi vill stärka vårt Team Mixersystem med en senior utvecklare som vill och kan bidra både med erfarenhet av att leda arbete i tekniskt avancerade miljöer och med kunskaper om hur man bygger en arkitektur där ljudet hela tiden är i fokus.


Arbetet bedrivs både digitalt och på plats. Då vi verkar i en tekniskt avancerad miljö är kravet på samarbete stort, både inom och utanför teamet. Att agera som mentor och utveckla teamets tekniska förmåga är en merit.


**Vad du kommer att göra?**



Jobba i ett agilt utvecklingsteam där mixern står i centrum. Vi har dagliga standups, demos, reviews och retros för ständigt lärande.


Du kommer tillsammans med teamet att vara ansvarig för analys, systemdesign, utveckling och  

implementation av produkter och tjänster kopplade till mixern.


Vi deltar aktivt i kodgranskningar för att säkerställa och lyfta våra standarder till nya höjder.


Du har lätt för att förmedla kunskap till andra samt en vana vid och ett stort intresse av att skapa och hålla ihop en hållbar arkitektur för teamets vägval och lösningar.



Här finns stora möjligheter till vidareutveckling.


  
**Vem är du?**



Du är en senior backendutvecklare med djup kompetens inom .NET (C#). Du är även duktig på Kubernetes, bygg-pipelines, arkitektur, säkerhet, övervakning, och event-/köbaserad kommunikation.


Meriterande är kunskap om Ljud över IP.



Du håller din kunskap uppdaterad med omvärldsbevakning och ständig nyfikenhet.



Du har lätt för att sätta dig in i befintlig kod men gillar också att planera och starta igång från grunden.


Du är en driven och prestigelös person med erfarenhet av att ta en mycket aktiv roll i arbetet kring att ta fram en ny och modern teknisk lösning som till viss del inte gjorts förut.


Du trivs med att aktivt ta del av diskussioner som för teamet framåt.


Har du kompetens från mediebranschen med ljud eller bild är det värdefullt.


**Vad vi erbjuder dig**



På Sveriges Radio vill vi att du ska få chansen att utvecklas. Vi är generösa med fortbildning, och deltar i både nationella och internationella samarbeten. Eftersom vi är en lärande organisation har vi ett stort utbud av interna högkvalitativa kurser. I vardagen lyfter vi varandra, lär och utvecklas tillsammans genom workshops, ensembleprogrammering och demos. Vi ser bara fördelar med allas våra olikheter och är stolta över att vi jobbar på en arbetsplats där alla har chans att göra skillnad.


**Vår värdegrund**
  

Sveriges Radio är en värdestyrd organisation. Det är därför viktigt att dina värderingar stämmer överens med våra.  

Läs mer om vår värdegrund på vår karriärsida.


**Anställning**
  

Tillsvidareanställning med inledande 6 månaders provanställning och tillträde enligt överenskommelse.


**Ansökan**
  

Sista ansökningsdag är 2024-06-23 men intervjuer och urval sker löpande så vänta inte med din ansökan! Vill du veta mer? Kontakta Jenny Norell på jenny.norell@sr.se



Fackliga frågor besvaras av Unionen, Saco och Journalistförbundet, samtliga nås genom växeln på 08-7845000

title: Data Platform Architect, Solna / Hybrid
description:
*Do you want to be part of a dynamic and rapidly changing environment at one of the Nordic region´s largest companies? If you work in Analytics Center of Excellence and are interested in developing our modern Analytic Data Platform Yoda, this is the job for you!*

**Join us:**
------------


The Analytics Center of Excellence department have today 14 employees who are responsible for building, running and develop our modern Analytics Data Platform build I Azure.


The unit contributes to the strategy to make Postnord more data driven by providing a platform where the business can work independently in a Hub and spoke model.  

The platform provides a devops environment containing different analytic capabilities.

**Job duties**
--------------


In the role of Data Platform Architect, you will be responsible for the architectural design. We have a great breadth and variety in our assignments and are often in collaboration with several different parts of our Nordic Group.


You will work with, among other things:

* Oversees the development, deployment, and management of data infrastructure while also guiding the architectural decisions for analytical platforms.
* Lead the design and implementation of a comprehensive analytical platform architecture that supports data ingestion, processing, storage, and analysis needs of the organization.
* Evaluate and integrate cutting-edge technologies and frameworks into the data platform to enhance its capabilities and ensure it remains at the forefront of data analytics infrastructure.
* Oversee a team of data engineers in developing robust, scalable data pipelines that efficiently transport and transform data across systems and platforms
* Champion best practices in data engineering, including code quality, data security, and performance optimization.
* Develop and enforce governance policies for the use and management of the analytical platform, including data quality, compliance, and access controls.
* Ensure the platform meets all security requirements and complies with relevant data protection regulations.
* Work closely with business leaders, data scientists, BI developers, and IT to align the analytical platform's capabilities with organizational goals and data strategies
* Translate business requirements into technical solutions, ensuring the platform supports a wide range of analytical and reporting needs.
* Monitor emerging trends in data engineering and analytics technologies, adopting new tools and practices that can enhance the platform's functionality and efficiency.
* Foster a culture of innovation and continuous improvement within the data engineering team.

**We are looking for you who have**
-----------------------------------

* Experience in data engineering with a proven track record in designing and implementing large-scale data platforms, preferably in a leadership role.
* Extensive knowledge of data architecture principles, data engineering tools, and big data technologies (e.g., Spark, Kafka).
* Experience with cloud data services (Azure, AWS, Google Cloud) and understanding of cloud architecture best practices for analytics.
* Experience with DevOps practices and CI/CD methodologies tailored to data workflows, ensuring streamlined development and deployment processes
* Strong proficiency in programming and scripting languages relevant to data engineering (e.g., Python, SQL, Scala).
* Demonstrated ability to lead and mentor a team of data engineers, promoting technical excellence.
* Familiarity with data governance, privacy laws, and compliance frameworks (e.g., GDPR, CCPA).

**Suggestions – We are looking for you who have**
-------------------------------------------------

* Experience of qualified work Data Platform Azure
* Relevant academic education
* Documented competence in working with Data Platform Architecture


We belive you are a person that is thourough, analytical and easy to get acquaninted with and learn new systems. Your way of working is inlusive, structured and responsible. You need to be able to handle stressful situations and prioritize job tasks independently. You are communicative and easy to collaborate with, and are unretentious in your way of creating and nurturing long-term relationships.

**We offer you**
----------------


We offer a variety of work in an international environment with constantly new challenges and quick decisions. Here you have opportunities to develop creative solutions and work in a prestige-free group where we jointly help to reach our goals. PostNord is one of Sweden's largest workplaces and we offer safe employment conditions and benefits. In addition to the benefits mentioned above, we offer:

* Hybrid workplace with a Nordic and dynamic environment. Watch the video about our office.
* Great development opportunities
* Great insurance and occupational pension terms
* Wellness allowance & opportunity to train at Arken's gym and indoor swimming pool
* Employee benefits through PostNord Plus - PostNord´s own personnel foundation

**We make everyday life easier**
--------------------------------


PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region. We are in a constant transformation and work consistently to develop both our offer and our employees, all to achieve our vision of being The favorite carrier of the Nordics. We are PostNord - a fantastic company to work and grow with. Read more at postnord.com

**Apply**
---------


We look forward to receive your application!


If you have any questions or concerns, please contact Pernille Skovborg on phone number: +4528120568


Don't wait to submit your application as we go through the applications on an ongoing basis.


For union representatives, visit: www.postnord.com/fackliga


We are looking forward to hear from you!

 **#LI-Hybrid**

title: Area Lead Engineer – Integration Platforms
description:
**Job Description**  

Do you want to play an integral part in accelerating H&Ms digitalization journey? If your heart races at the thought of Engineering and Integration, and you are passionate about evaluating, developing and implementing innovative integration platforms and services then we've got an incredible opportunity waiting for you. As Area Lead Engineer at H&M Group, you will be responsible for four Engineering teams (API Platform, Event Platforms, Developer Portal and Integration Services) within the Integration Platforms & Services Unit. You will be partnering with other visionary teams to support our unit to drive the mission of empowering product teams to build sustainable and secure integration solutions for faster time to market.


In your role you will be working closely with relevant stakeholders, you’ll dive deep into the organization's requirements and needs, offering critical insights that help our product managers and software engineers within the unit to maintain and develop new capabilities on the central platforms. You will lead the teams dedicated to operating and maintain central platforms such as API management service, Event platforms, API Developer Portal and integration services and tools but also to build enhancements and improvements on these platforms for engineers to utilize to be able to deliver business solutions. The area should deliver best-in-class engineering services that improves H&M’s speed to market, flexibility, and scalability by providing frictionless technology with self-service capabilities.

**Key responsibilities:**

* Develop and execute a strategic roadmap for API, event, and integration platforms in alignment with the organization’s goals and objectives.
* Ensure high availability, performance, and reliability of all managed platforms.
* Ensure simplified and efficient self-service capabilities of all managed platforms.
* Monitor and manage the financial impact of decisions and priorities of the product teams.
* Collaborate with other distributed product teams to deliver/consume new capabilities provided by the Integration Platforms & Services Unit.
* Develop strong relationships and work cross-functionally with many teams across organizations and functions, and as a result, deliver solid and future proof integration solutions that deliver business value.
* Lead and provide technical guidance to the teams.
* Mentor and coach, your team members to enable them to grow professionally and increase their performance.

  

**Qualifications**  

You'll be part of evaluating new technologies, ensuring they align with H&M's mission for product and service excellence. We're seeking someone with a forward-looking mindset who's not just ready for change, but who embraces it with enthusiasm and foresight. If this sounds like you, then let's embark on this exciting journey together at H&M Group.

**What you need to succeed:**

* Knowledge of API platforms (Azure API management, MuleSoft) and in-depth knowledge of how to maintain and operate them on a large scale in an Enterprise
* Knowledge of Event platforms (Solace PubSub+, Azure EventGrid, Kafka)
* Knowledge of API first strategy and Event-driven architecture and implementation of integration using APIs and Events
* 10+ years of software engineering work experience, including hands-on work with integration solutions such as API management platforms and Event platforms
* Minimum of 5+ years of product management with demonstrated success defining and launching excellent products.
* Demonstrated experience recruiting and managing technical teams, including performance management.
* Demonstrated experience in maintaining test and production environments.
* Deep understanding of public cloud technologies (Azure & GCP primary)
* Strong agile mindset and skilled in planning, prioritizing, execution, and follow ups with cross functional teams.
* Strong communication, leadership, and problem-solving skills.

  

**Additional Information**  

This is a **full-time position** based at our office in Stockholm. Apply by sending in your **CV in English** as soon as possible, but no later than the **04th of July 2024**. Interviews will be held continuously. Due to data policies, we only accept applications through the career page.

**Benefits**  

We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP.  

In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.

**Inclusion & Diversity**  

H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organization. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas.


Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.


We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.

**Company Description**


H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way. Learn more about H&M here.
company_description: At H&M, we welcome you to be yourself and challenge you to grow and make a difference. Help us reimagine the future of an entire industry, making everyone look, feel & do good.

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
About Kindred


Kindred Group is a digital entertainment pioneer bringing together nine successful online gambling brands, forming one of the largest online gambling groups in the world. Our purpose is to transform gambling by being a trusted source of entertainment that contributes positively to society. Our goal is that 0% revenue is derived from harmful gambling.



Our global team of more than 2000 people represents 70+ nationalities. When you join Kindred, you'll be part of a collaborative, diverse and inclusive team that has your best interest at heart. We are a trusting company that knows the value of a healthy work-life balance. We offer a wide range of benefits, along with annual bonus, which is tied to both company and your individual performance.

  

The Role



Are you passionate about cloud technology? Do you thrive in a fast-paced and technically challenging environment? If so, here is your chance. We are looking for a DevOps Engineer to join our team.



The open position is within the Platform and Application Engineering Services team, which is a vital part of the Application Managements and Operations (AMO) department. The Platform and Application Engineering Services team is responsible for overseeing the group's Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery tools, along with related automation, as part of developing our Platform as a Service (PaaS) offering for both on-premises and cloud environments.



The deliverables generally focus on automating DevOps processes to streamline product development and reduce time to market for our customer services. You will be joining a team that values strong working relationships, prioritizes high quality and availability, and adopts a zero-downtime approach.



In this role you will work with other DevOps Engineers to build and maintain the infrastructure that is critical to running Kindreds Core Data Platform, Data Analytics, and Machine Learning Platforms, as well as your own personal growth. You should be open to learning new technologies and be enthusiastic about sharing your knowledge.

  




What you will do:


* Maintain Kindred Cloud platform and driving all changes through automation.
* Support, develop, and deliver Cloud Services to the organization.
* Provide support to engineering teams.
* Set up tools and required Cloud infrastructure.
* Define and set development, test, release, update, and support processes for Cloud operation.
* Incident management and root cause analysis.
* Implement controls and operational best practice for cloud usage.

  



Your experience:


* Knowledge of a Programming Language, for example Python.
* Good understanding of Cloud Infrastructure, for example EKS, EC2, EBS, Lambda, S3, MSK, and CloudWatch.
* Knowledge of Infrastructure as Code such as Terraform.
* Good understanding of CI/CD tools such as Jenkins or cloud-native solutions.
* Knowledge of Kubernetes, Containers, and Helm deployment.
* Ability to drive new technical projects & solutions with strong autonomy.
* Experience within open source and appliance products.
* Software developer mindset, troubleshooting techniques, and solving problems through repeatable and testable automation.
* Verbal and written communication skills.
  


Our Way Of Working


Our world is hybrid.



A career is not a sprint. It’s a marathon. One of the perks of joining us is that we value you as a person first. Our hybrid world allows you to focus on your goals and responsibilities and lets you self-organise to improve your deliveries and get the work done in your own way.


Application Process


Click on the “” button and complete the short web form. Please add your CV and covering letter in English to let us know your motivation for applying and your salary expectation. Our Talent Acquisition team will be in touch soon. Kindred is an equal opportunities employer committed to employing a diverse workforce and an inclusive culture. As such we oppose all forms of discrimination in the workplace. We create equal opportunities for all our applicants and will treat people equally regardless of and not limited to, gender, ages, disability, race, sexual orientation. We are committed not only to our legal obligations but also to the positive promotion that equal opportunities bring to our operations as set out in our sustainability framework. Kindred has an ESG rating of AAA by MCSI.

title: Lead Frontend Engineer at global leader in media delivery
description:
**Net Insights Sync team, working on precise networked time synchronization, needs reinforcement; if you're a Frontend Engineer with a hunger for a challenge - Keep reading!**

 **OFFER**  

Net Insight offers the possibility to work hands-on with cutting-edge technology and products used by millions. Together in a close-knit team with colleagues who share a passion for delivering top-quality products, you have the chance to enable reliable live experiences for a global and diverse audience.

  

The teams are cross-functional and there will be opportunities to move between the teams. They empower individuals and teams and encourage open communication/collaboration across teams.


**Some of the benefits of working at Net Insight:**

* An open and flat organization with a lot of teamwork
* Run a very technologically advanced environment
* A family-friendly company, with an understanding of the necessity of a healthy work/life balance
* Every employee is valuable and can drive changes and influence the product as well as WoW.
* Unusually low turnover – High employee satisfaction

 **THE TEAM HIRING**  

You will be part of the Sync team, a team working on a new product that focuses on their algorithm for time synchronization. It is about using different time sources (atomic clock, PPS, GNSS, measurement of round-trip times in the network) to be able to calculate the time at the nanosecond level in their nodes.

*WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?*
  

Apart from the fact that you will be joining a team focused on innovation and in new areas you probably haven’t discovered yet; you would be the only frontend developer in the team. Meaning you are taking the lead on all aspects of the frontend development lifecycle, including requirements, design, architecture, deployment, etc. Given this, you will be granted a lot of freedom to shape the future of the front-end area in this team, and your contribution will significantly impact the product.

  



**YOUR PROFILE**
  

We are looking for someone that has a few years of experience as a full-stack or frontend developer, preferably focused on the latter which is an area where you’re passionate and skilled. You are comfortable in a role making quick decisions with a creative and experimental approach.


You will be working with skilled engineers who are open to learning new things and value working in a team to achieve a common goal. Therefore, you should have great communication and organizational skills.


Seen to the technical elements of the role, you need to have:

* Be fluent in TypeScript/JavaScript
* Experience with React or similar (e.g Angular)
* Experience with Material UI or Similar (e.g Bootstrap)
* Experience with Unit tests (e.g. Jest or similar)

Extra bonus if you have some experience with:

  

* Node.Js
* Grafana
* Docker/K8s
* Visualizing large networks with d3js, Sigma.Js or similar
* UI-testing with e.f Selenium or Cypress
  




**ABOUT NET INSIGHT**

  

Net Insight (Nasdaq: NETI B) is a global leader in media networks, resource optimization, and streaming solutions. With more than 25 years of experience, Net Insight is a trusted and important partner and a leading force in the media tech industry in creating a better media experience. More than 500 world-class customers run mission-critical media services using Net Insight’s solutions in more than 60 countries worldwide.  



With their extensive experience in the professional media industry, the world’s leading media providers have relied on Net insight’s Emmy-winning Nimbra solution to guarantee their media transport and accurately synchronize TV and media services over existing IP networks independently of GNSS/GPS. Net Insight now brings this uniquely established knowledge into the future mobile networks to solve 5G TDD time synchronization independent of GNSS/GPS by approaching it as an open disaggregated virtualized end-to-end service provided independent of the underlying network is for Net Insight the only future-proof approach.


For more info, visit https://netinsight.net/

**ABOUT PINETREE**  

At Pinetree, we have a vision and mission to differentiate ourselves from the crowd and are Sweden's contenders in talent search and matching. By working as an agency, the value to you as an employee is that we have an extensive network of partner companies that we continuously ensure high-quality standards.

**This recruitment is direct employment at Net Insight AB and all applications, questions, and administration of the recruitment process are managed by Pinetree AB.**

title: Full Stack Developer to Net Insight's 5G Sync solution
description:
**Net Insight is a pioneering technology company that powers large-scale live broadcast events, connecting millions of viewers globally. Since 2021, they have established a rapidly expanding solution area focused on Synchronization. Leveraging their patented TV distribution synchronization technology, the Zyntai product portfolio is designed for nationwide 5G and power networks. We are now looking for a Fullstack developer to join them!**

  



**OFFER**  

At Net Insight you will find expertise, a knowledge-sharing culture, and an environment that spans the entire range, from hardware development to cloud applications to customer care – and everything in between.


Together with people excited about innovative technology projects and driving customer success, you will help build a unique solution for transporting time with extremely high precision over IP infrastructure.


Some of the benefits of working at Net Insight:

* An open and flat organization with a lot of teamwork
* Cutting-edge technology, in a technologically very advanced environment
* A company that values and understands the necessity of a healthy work/life balance.
* Every employee is valuable, drives changes, and influences the product as well as the way of working.
* Unusually low turnover – High employee satisfaction

 **THE PRODUCT AREA**
  

Synchronization is already making success for 5G worldwide and so far; Net Insight has established collaborations with large telecom operators in Europe and North America and over 20 nationwide TV networks.


5G Synchronization offers solutions to enable faster and more secure 5G rollouts. The core functionality is to distribute time over networks, GNSS independent, and with extremely high accuracy.


The solution consists of new purpose-built hardware, advanced software-based automation algorithms, and a cloud-based management system. All are built with modern architecture and technologies. Read more about the product here: https://netinsight.net/5g-mobile-operators/

 **THE TEAM & POSITION**
  

In this role you will together with a team of five, help design and build the Management system for the new 5G Synchronization solution. You will be focusing more on the front end than the back end – but will be involved in both. It is a big plus if you have an interest in UI/UX.


The system handles life-cycle management, metrics, alarms, etc for large networks of time-synchronization nodes. It runs in Kubernetes and is built with modern technologies and tools (e.g. Material UI, React, TS, Grafana).

*What's in it for you?*
  

You will enter the product in an early stage and there are plenty of challenges to solve. Additionally, they have lots of ideas on what they would like to add going forward – such as more intelligent network routing and advanced analytics. This means you will have a lot of freedom to set the foundation for the implementation of this and future products.

 **ABOUT YOU**  

First of all, the above info should excite you at least a little – because the candidate we are searching for is curious and eager to shape the future of 5G. Other than that, you are communicative and see collaboration as the key to success and you like working closely with your colleagues. You are productive and motivated to complete tasks, always with quality as a priority.
  

  

We believe you have experience in many, but not necessarily all, of the below areas:

* TypeScript/JavaScript
* React or similar (e.g. Angular)
* Material UI or similar (e.g. bootstrap)
* Git
* Node.js
* Grafana
* Linux
* AWS/Public cloud
* Docker/K8s/OpenShift/OKD
* Experience from unit tests, e.g. Jest or similar.
* Experience of UI-testing with e.g. Selenium or Cypress

  

**WELCOME TO APPLY**  

The position is permanent, full-time employment located at the headquarters in Solna. Net Insight values work-life balance; therefore, you can combine remote work and work from the office.

 **ABOUT NET INSIGHT**  

Net Insight is a global leader in media networks, resource optimization, and streaming solutions. With more than 20 years of experience, Net Insight is a trusted and important partner and a leading force in the media tech industry in creating a better media experience.


More than 500 world-class customers run mission-critical media services using Net Insight’s solutions in more than 70 countries worldwide. Net Insight is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm.


Net Insight is powering the evolving media business in a connected world where technology enables seamless meetings between producers, distributors, and consumers of content – regardless of geographical location, technical resources, or distribution network. With its deep market knowledge and insight, genuine customer focus, and world-leading innovative technology, Net Insight makes it easier to create and deliver better content in a more reliable and effective way. Net Insight is driven by the idea that everything can always be done smarter, for both its customers and their customers.

 **ABOUT PINETREE**

  

At Pinetree, we have a vision and mission to differentiate ourselves from the crowd and are Sweden's contenders in talent search and matching.


By working as an agency, the value to you as an employee is that we have a very wide network of partner companies that we continuously ensure high-quality standards.

**This recruitment is a direct employment at Net Insight AB and all applications, questions, administration, and recruitment process is managed by Pinetree AB.**

title: Enterprise Business Developer Manager - Nordics
description:
NVIDIA has been redefining computer graphics, PC gaming, and accelerated computing for more than 25 years. It’s an outstanding legacy of innovation that’s motivated by extraordinary technology—and outstanding people.
We are seeking an senior Enterprise Business Developer Manager who is passionate about customer experience and with the outcome to make NVIDIA captivating, secure and scale customers AI strategies and maximum NVIDIA awareness into strategic verticals and initiatives. This role is responsible for customer success at selected NVIDIA customers and Center Of Excellences. You will be the key point of contact and post-sales relationship owner for a defined set of customers, driving successful adoption, retention, expansion and advocacy of NVIDIA solutions. You will also be required to proactively support the Nordic team with strategic initiatives to increase national innovation capabilities.
What you'll be doing:* Establish relationships with customer contacts for the successful implementation of NVIDIA software solutions at the customer site.
* Support the Nordic Enterprise Sales team to increase the NVIDIA footprint at selected Innovation hubs to scale within focus verticals and industries.
* Develop success plans to optimally and efficiently move customers to their desired business outcomes (retention) and grow revenue (upsell), prospect into new departments (cross-sell).
* Consistently develop business value metrics and support internal development of resources, education, and tools.
* Lead customer onboarding including crafting/completing checklist templates and detailing status, next steps; accelerate customer time to value by addressing any operational blocks and proactively supporting customer through any external project issues; Be a trusted advisor to end-users, ensuring clients derive maximum value from their investment.
* Identify risks to the customer achieving their stated business goals and work with the account team to build a risk mitigation plan.
* Supervise customer usage data, health indicators, renewal dates and growth opportunities and translate into strategies for success.
* Help to improve our products by acting as a customer advocate.


What we need to see:* BA degree or equivalent experience.
* 10+ years of demonstrated ability in sales, professional services, or customer facing solution architecture role.
* A solid understanding of the NVIDIA enterprise software portfolio
* A real passion for getting things done in a multifaceted sales and technology environment.
* Demonstrated ability to provide thought leadership, think strategically and effectively communicate vision (both written and verbal) and influence cross-functionally.


Ways to stand out from the crowd:* Exceptional project management experience and development of thoughtful customer success plans that lead to true customer delight.
* Understanding of workflows, modern machine learning and AI trends.
* A strong curiosity about new technologies and adept at conveying their value to customer(s).
* Demonstrated ability to work cross-functionally in a highly matrixed environment.
* Drive, Passion, Curiosity, Team mentality and Growth mindset


NVIDIA is committed to encouraging a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Är du en driven SW Developer, missa inte chansen…
description:
### **JOB DESCRIPTION**



**Är du en driven SW Developer** och vill du vara en del av en verksamhet där personlig utveckling, möjligheter och affärer är i fokus? Där du som individ får ta ansvar och testa dina idéer? På en arbetsplats där vi alltid ställer upp för varandra, gör saker tillsammans och har roligt längs vägen? Ja, då har du hittat rätt! Bli en del av vårt bästa team! Det blir ett äventyr att se fram emot…



**På Sigma Technology Embedded Solutions i Linköping hjälper vi varandra** att utveckla och utvecklas. Vi strävar alltid efter att arbeta med ny teknik och kompletta leveranslösningar till våra kunder. Med en kundbas över hela Sverige kan vi erbjuda dig att arbeta antingen remote från din hemort eller från något av våra kontor i Göteborg, Borås, Skövde, Jönköping, Linköping eller Stockholm. Våra anställda och partners arbetar både inhouse i vår R&D avdelning och onsite hos våra kunder med spännande uppdrag inom konsumentmarknaden, FinTech, fordon, telekom, logistik & produktion, MedTech, försvar m.fl.



**Väx tillsammans med oss – bli vår kollega!** Med en hög kompetens inom Embedded systems development, Augmented Reality, Autonomous Drive, Digitalization, Cybersec, AI och Electrification har vi växt kraftigt det senaste året och behöver bli fler! Berätta vad du vill göra, så testar vi om det går :) Vi vill bygga vår tillväxt utefter dina visioner och mål!



**Rollen som konsult är mångfacetterad**, så det finns många möjligheter att utvecklas. Just nu är det full fart inom exempelvis Elektrifiering.



Du har möjlighet att vara delaktig i hela SW utvecklingsprocessen: från kravarbete till design, implementation och verifiering. Tyngdpunkten blir oftast på utveckling och verifiering av inbyggda system i branscher såsom fordon, konsumentprodukter och försvar.



Beroende på din profil och ditt intresse kan du också få arbeta med implementera tester samt att köra och utvärdera testresultat - både högnivå- och lågnivåtester. Test är något många bolag behöver hjälp med idag.



När vi kodar gör vi det oftast i C/C++ och Python samt Matlab/Simulink miljö.


### **BASIC QUALIFICATIONS**



**Vi ser gärna att du har** med dig en ingenjörsexamen inom datavetenskap, teknisk fysik, elektronik, mekatronik eller motsvarande kompetens samt en bakgrund inom några av följande:


* Erfarenhet av hårdvarunära programmering
* Goda programmeringskunskaper i C/C++
* Script-språk, t.ex. Python
* Operativsystem, t.ex. Linux/Embedded Linux/RTOS
* Versionshantering, t.ex. Git
* Ärendehanteringssystem, t.ex. Jira/Confluence
* Agil utvecklingsmetodik, t.ex. SCRUM
* CI/CD
* Ett giltigt svenskt arbetstillstånd och visum
* Svenska språket


### **PREFERRED ADDITIONAL SKILLS, PERSONAL TRAITS AND EXPERIENCE**



**Det är meriterande om du har kunskap om:**



* Functional safety/ISO 26262
* Matlab/Simulink
* Förståelse för kravanalys av kund och systemkrav
* Arkitektur

### **WE OFFER**



**Bli en i vårt lag!**


Vi tror på långsiktighet och vill att du ska trivas hos oss, länge! Därför är vi nyfikna på dina drivkrafter och vad som ger dig energi. Vi vill erbjuda dig intressanta uppdrag som får dig att utvecklas, men också en kultur som får dig att le. Hos oss tar vi alla ett ansvar för vår tillväxt. Vi växer tillsammans. Vi är ett lag. Därför välkomnar vi både innovation och utveckling – du har möjlighet att påverka.



I Universums senaste undersökning ar fick vi utmärkelsen Sweden ’s Most Recommended Employer samt hamnade på tredje plats i Sweden’s Best Employers 2020 .


**Bli vår kollega** på bästa Sigma Technology Embedded Solutions !



**Tveka inte att höra av dig, en förändring börjar alltid med en kontakt ;)**

description:

Du kommer att få omfattande utbildning vid vårt forskning- och utvecklingscenter i Tumba. Du får en anställning med stora utvecklings- och karriärmöjligheter.

I rollen som servicetekniker på DeLaval ingår även att du tar ansvar för administration kopplat till det arbete du utför.  


**Kvalifikationer och erfarenheter**

Gymnasieutbildning, gärna el- eller teknikprogram, maskin- och lastbilsteknik, eller liknande och gärna med arbetslivserfarenhet.* Ett stort tekniskt intresse med praktisk läggning.

* Erfarenhet eller intresse av djurhållning och mjölkproduktion.
* God datorvana och lätt för att lära system och program.
* Goda kunskaper i svenska i såväl tal som skrift samt god förståelse av engelska.
* Lantbrukserfarenhet är meriterande.

  


**Är du:**
* Ansvarstagande med handlingskraft och förmåga att fatta egna beslut.
* Serviceinriktad med förmåga att skapa goda relationer med kunden i fokus.
* Strukturerad med förmåga att planera och prioritera.
* Kommunikativ.
* Lösningsorienterad.

  


**Vi erbjuder dig**Ett ansvarsfullt och självständigt arbete i en trivsam och öppen företagskultur som präglas av god gemenskap och en passion för vad vi gör. Du har i rollen på DeLaval möjligheter att påverka Sveriges lantbrukares framtid och ekonomi – du kan göra skillnad!  


**Övrigt**
Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning med tillträde enligt överenskommelse. Tjänsten innebär resor med din servicebil med hemmet som utgångspunkt, B-körkort är ett krav. Resor och övernattningar förekommer i tjänsten och vid behov kan du behöva arbeta på kringliggande distrikt.  

Har du frågor gällande tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef Jonas Nilsson tel: 073-056 4023  


**Välkommen med** **din ansökan senast den 21 juni 2024! Vi tillämpar löpande** **intervjuer.**  

**Om DeLaval**
Vår vision är att möjliggöra hållbar livsmedelsproduktion. Som ett företag som bygger på innovation arbetar vi ständigt med att hitta sätt att hjälpa våra kunder, mjölkproducenter, att göra mer med mindre genom att tillhandahålla världsledande mjölkningsutrustning och lösningar.  


Idag har DeLaval cirka 4500 passionerade yrkesverksamma som verkar på mer än 100 marknader runt om i världen. DeLaval är en del av Tetra Laval-gruppen. Välkommen att läsa mer på www.delavalcorporate.com

title: Function Development Engineer
description:
We are excited to expand our team with talented and passionate engineers who specialize in model-based development. As we continue to drive innovation in electrification, we invite engineers who are ready to make a significant impact in this dynamic field to join us.

  

In your role, you will be a part of our customers’ missions to drive the technology shift within the fields of *electrification*. As a consultant for several of our major international clients in the Gothenburg region, the work can be done both on-site or in our in-house projects. This position offers a broad and intriguing range of opportunities, making it ideal for engineers from diverse engineering backgrounds.

 **What we offer you**


At ALTEN, we believe in nurturing your passion for technology and innovation. With diverse projects across various industries, you’ll have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact on the world while advancing your own career. Our supportive leaders provide coaching and guidance to help you grow professionally. Additionally, you’ll have access to personalized training opportunities through our ALTEN Academy and external courses, empowering you to reach your full potential.



**Your profile**

  

The role as Function Developer will include modelling and simulation of energy systems and embedded systems development. Therefore, we seek individuals with strong knowledge in Matlab/Simulink. Some examples of areas you may work with are development and integration of embedded SW Battery Management Systems, functions for charging and control of batteries, and cooling and heating of battery systems. Beyond development, your responsibilities may include defining and documenting software and systems architecture, enhancing features, maintaining existing products, and fixing bugs.

  

Meritorious experience:

* Stateflow
* CANalyzer (or similar tool)
* Python
* CAN protocol
* Test and Validation


If you’re ready to take on an exciting challenge and contribute to groundbreaking projects, apply now! Your unique skills and perspective are essential to our team’s success as we drive innovation forward together!

 **About ALTEN**


ALTEN is one of Europe’s largest consulting companies within Engineering, IT and Life Sciences with over 57,000 employees in more than 30 countries. We’re a global actor with a local presence with 1400 committed colleagues in offices from Lund in the south to Skellefteå in the north. Our engineers carry out complex and highly technical projects throughout the product development chain of the most prestigious companies in sectors such as Automotive, Aerospace & Defense, Energy, Manufacturing, Public Sector and Life Sciences.

  

For four years in a row, ALTEN has been named one of Sweden’s most attractive employers by Karriärföretagen, an award for employers that offer unique career and development opportunities.
